intro: Oreocharis wenxianensis, commonly known as the Wenxian bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and creeping. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreocharis wenxianensis is considered a vulnerable species.
